intro: Serruria stilbe var. subbiternata, commonly known as the Natal starling's bean, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, bean-like fruits. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal regions. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
